summary: This bill, the Cerro de la Olla Wilderness Establishment Act, amends the John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act. It establishes the Cerro de la Olla Wilderness within the Río Grande del Norte National Monument in New Mexico, encompassing approximately 12,295 acres. The bill also modifies the monument's boundary and addresses wildlife water development projects within the newly designated wilderness area, allowing for their maintenance under certain conditions. It mandates a cooperative agreement with New Mexico for wildlife management activities.
